title: PMAXUD/PMAXUQ â€” Maximum of Packed Unsigned Integers

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`PMAXUD xmm1, xmm2/m128`
`VPMAXUD xmm1, xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VPMAXUD ymm1, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VPMAXUD xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m32bcst`
`VPMAXUD ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m32bcst`
`VPMAXUD zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m32bcst`
`VPMAXUQ xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m64bcst`
`VPMAXUQ ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m64bcst`
`VPMAXUQ zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m64bcst`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Performs a SIMD compare of the packed unsigned dword or qword integers in the second source operand and the first source operand and returns the maximum value for each pair of integers to the destination operand.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: 128-bit Legacy SSE version: The first source and destination operands are XMM registers. The second source operand is an XMM register or a 128-bit memory location. Bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding destination register remain unchanged.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.128 encoded version: The first source and destination operands are XMM registers. The second source operand is an XMM register or a 128-bit memory location. Bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding destination register are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.256 encoded version: The first source operand is a YMM register; The second source operand is a YMM register or 256-bit memory location. Bits (MAXVL-1:256) of the corresponding destination register are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX encoded versions: The first source operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register; The second source operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register, a 512/256/128-bit memory location or a 512/256/128-bit vector broadcasted from a 32/64-bit memory location. The destination operand is conditionally updated based on writemask k1.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
